duties_responsibilities.duty: Completing daily auditing of pharmacy billing, anesthesia records, and narcotics to ensure accuracy.
Collaborating with Compliance for resolution of billing discrepancies and reporting financial data to the Director of Pharmacy.
Overseeing and troubleshooting ADM systems, completing manual billing, and reconciling the daily revenue bounce report.
Reviewing high-cost items and chemotherapy documentation for validation, and assisting in Pyxis and Boxpicker upgrades.
Demonstrating competence in chart and MAR review, par level maintenance, and Pyxis and SIS system use.
Participating in operational quality indicators, performance improvement activities, and purchasing responsibilities.
Assisting with committee meeting preparation and minutes, and collaborating with nursing and pharmacy leadership for monitoring and compliance.

education_certification.credential: High School Diploma, Current Pharmacy Technician License, and National Certified Pharmacy Technician (CPhT) certification required. Prior hospital experience and college degree preferred.
